text:
Hello peers,

I am integrating the HubSpot chatflow on my mobile application using the mobile sdk.

Using: implementation "com.HubSpot.mobilechatsdk:mobile-chat-sdk-android:1.0.0"

utilized the config settings provided in the inbox settings for android, placed in the assets folder under HubSpot-info.config file,

Now, on mainactivity.java:

```HubSpotManager manager = HubSpotManager.getInstance(getApplicationContext());
manager.configure();

startActivity(new Intent(context, HubSpotWebActivity.class));```
when I use the above piece of code, below are the errors:
\MainActivity.java:130: error: cannot find symbol
        HubSpotManager manager = HubSpotManager.getInstance(getApplicationContext());
                                               ^
  symbol:   method getInstance(Context)
  location: class HubSpotManager

\MainActivity.java:133: error: cannot find symbol
        startActivity(new Intent(context, HubSpotWebActivity.class));
                                 ^
  symbol:   variable context
  location: class MainActivity
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.


If anyone have any idea on this, please provide some help to solve this issue. Thanks
CC <@U07JHRHGYBV>, if you could have a look at this when you have the chance, thanks!
